content.text:
# Mujawar Cabinet

| date_dissolved          =
| government_head_title   = Prime Minister
| government_head         = Ali Muhammad Mujawar
| deputy_government_head_title  = Deputy Prime Ministers
| deputy_government_head  = Rashad al-AlimiAbdulkarim Al-Arhabi
| government_head_history =
| state_head_title        = President
| state_head              = Ali Abdullah Saleh
| current_number          =
| former_members_number   =
| total_number            =
| political_party         = |border=darkgray}} General People's Congress
| legislature_status      = Supermajority
| opposition_parties      = |border=darkgray}} Al-Islah|border=darkgray}} Yemeni Socialist Party|border=darkgray}} NUPO|border=darkgray}} Arab Socialist Ba'ath Party
| opposition_leader       =

The Mujawar Cabinet, led by Yemeni prime minister Ali Mohammed Mujawar took the constitutional oath before president Ali Abdullah Saleh on 7 April 2007. The cabinet was made up of 33 ministers.
